c74object.name: fl.combinetags~
c74object.digest: Combines a number of tagged input frames into a single tagged output frame
c74object.description: The number of inputs is set using a parameter. All inputs trigger output. Tagged frames arriving asynchronously are sent to the output. Tagged frames arriving synchronously are combined at the output.

entry.name: /num_ins [int]
entry.description:
INSTANTIATION ONLYSets the number of inputs.
(default: 2)

objarg.name: num_ins
objarg.description:
This argument sets the num_ins parameter:
Sets the number of inputs.
(default: 2)

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.combinetags~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.combinetags~. When set to 0 fl.combinetags~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.combinetags~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
